page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO SIDLESHAM
page.content: Sidlesham is a village on the Selsey Peninsula to the south of the city of Chichester in the county of West Sussex. There is no natural centre to the village yet it retains the customs and traditions of a friendly and caring community. Pagham Harbour Nature Reserve is the main attraction in the village for the visitor. The main feature of the landscape is the holdings with their glasshouses. This is a lively village with much to see and enjoy for the person who enjoys the country village life.
